extraction.summary: This section argues that design should accommodate human nature rather than blame users for errors, presenting seven stages of action as a design framework. extraction.summary: This section explores how long-term memory works and the critical difference between learning arbitrary versus meaningful information. extraction.summary: This section explores how knowledge can be distributed between memory in the head and memory in the world, with focus on reminders, prospective memory, and the tradeoffs between these two storage modes.
